page.title: 11VISIT TO THE LOCK
page.content: It was raining hard when we arrived at the canal.We walked along the tow-path until we met Mr Gammie,the lock keeper. We soon learnt there were as many as 11 locks in the Atherstone district.It took around ten minutes for a boat to get through a lock.Industries used the canals,especially coal mining.Today only 4 coal boats go up and down the canal.There are around 24 barges and boats passing through Atherstone each day,now they are nearly all holiday makers.Locks can be very dangerous.With all our questions answered we went back out in the rain to the first lock.Mr Gammie wound the lock and we pushed the large gate open and all the water rushed in.The water level soon became the same, that is when the boat could pass through.After taking photographs under the bridge we left. STEVE WEBSTER AGED 10
